workflow.name: Generate GEO-optimized support replies from Gmail to Gmail and Slack
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Streamline customer support with a real-time, AI-powered answer engine that detects incoming support emails, classifies intent, identifies the customer‚Äôs GEO region, and generates a tailored reply ready to send. üìß

ü§ñ This workflow intelligently adjusts tone and clarity based on region (US, UK, India, Canada, Australia, etc.) and ensures every outgoing message is structured, compliant, and highly contextual. Valid queries receive an automated reply via Gmail and a Slack summary, while non-support messages are flagged for manual review. A perfect automation for scaling support operations with precision and personalization. üåç‚ö°

## üîÅ What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Listens for unread incoming emails using Gmail Trigger. üì•
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Extracts sender, subject, and message snippet for analysis. üîç
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Uses AI to classify if the email is a real support query. ü§ñ
 4Ô∏è‚É£ If valid, predicts the customer‚Äôs GEO region (US/UK/India/Canada/EU/etc.). üåç
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Generates a GEO-optimized reply in structured JSON (subject, body, tone). ‚úçÔ∏è
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Formats the AI response and sends the final email via Gmail. üì§
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Sends a Slack notification summarizing the reply, GEO used, and outcome. üí¨
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Routes non-query emails to Slack for manual human review. ‚ö†Ô∏è
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Includes strict JSON validation to avoid malformed AI outputs. üìê
 üîü Logs summary details for reporting and operations visibility. üìä

## ‚≠ê Key Benefits
‚úÖ Automates personalized support replies with region-specific tone
 ‚úÖ Eliminates manual triage of common support queries
 ‚úÖ Ensures consistent, professional, and compliant customer communication
 ‚úÖ Reduces response time with real-time processing
 ‚úÖ Flags edge-cases and non-queries for manual review
 ‚úÖ Integrates seamlessly with Gmail + Slack for end-to-end visibility

## üß© Features
- Gmail Trigger for real-time email intake
- AI classification (support vs non-support)
- GEO inference engine based on language, email, and context
- GPT-4o-mini for tailored response generation
- Strict structured JSON output parsing
- Slack notifications for both automated replies and manual reviews
- Error handling with Slack alerting
- Full automation loop from triage ‚Üí reply ‚Üí logging

## üîê Requirements
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials
- Slack API credentials
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4o-mini)
- n8n with LangChain nodes enabled

## üéØ Target Audience
- Customer support teams needing faster personalized replies
- SaaS founders and solopreneurs automating support
- Global support teams managing multi-region messaging
- Operations teams wanting consistent support tone and compliance

workflow.name: Generate GEO-optimized support replies from Gmail to Gmail and Slack

options.systemMessage:
=You detect the customer's GEO region based on their email content, email address, language hints, currency mentions, city names, or spelling style.

Return ONLY one simple GEO label:
"US", "UK", "India", "Canada", "EU", "Australia", "UAE", or "Unknown".

Respond ONLY in valid JSON.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "to": "user@example.com",
  "subject": "Re: Shipping to Canada?",
  "reply": "Hello Laura,\n\nYes, we do ship to Canada. Standard delivery takes 5‚Äì7 business days, and orders above CAD $70 qualify for free shipping. For other orders, shipping is CAD $12.\n\nIf you need help placing the order, I‚Äôd be happy to assist.\n\nBest regards,\nBrandX Support",
  "geo_used": "Canada",
  "summary": "Provided shipping info and fees for a customer in Canada."
}

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert customer support agent.

Your job:
Generate a GEO-optimized, ready-to-send support email reply AND return it in a clean structured JSON format.

GEO Tone Rules:
- US: direct, casual
- UK: polite, formal
- India: warm, guiding
- Canada/EU: neutral, compliance-friendly
- Australia: friendly, informal

Output Requirements:
- ALWAYS respond with VALID JSON only.
- No markdown.
- No extra explanation.
- No surrounding text.
- The "reply" field must contain the full email body text.

Return JSON in this EXACT format:

{
  "to": "string",
  "subject": "string",
  "reply": "string (full email body)",
  "geo_used": "string",
  "summary": "short 1-line summary of the reply"
}

=You are a classification engine.
Your job is to determine if an incoming email is a real customer support query.

Return ONLY JSON in this format:
{
  "is_query": true/false,
  "category": "support | sales | spam | internal | notification | other",
  "reason": "short explanation"
}

parameters.content:
## Real-Time GEO-Optimized Answer Engine ‚Äì Overview

This workflow listens for incoming customer emails, classifies whether they are support queries, detects the customer's GEO region, and generates a GEO-appropriate reply using AI. If the email is a valid query, the engine composes a ready-to-send reply tailored to regional tone and rules, sends it via Gmail, and posts a Slack notification. Non-query or ambiguous messages are routed for manual review. The workflow uses structured output parsers to force strict JSON at each AI step, and stores a short summary and GEO used for reporting.

### How it works
1. Gmail trigger captures unread inbound emails.  
2. AI classifies whether message is a support query.  
3. If a query: AI infers GEO, then produces a GEO-optimized reply (JSON).  
4. Reply is formatted and sent via Gmail; Slack is notified.  
5. If not a query: sends a manual review alert to Slack.

### Setup steps
- Add Gmail, Slack, and OpenAI credentials.  
- Verify parser schemas and Gmail send permissions.  
- Test with a few sample emails.

### Customization
Adjust GEO labels, tone rules, classification thresholds, or add more locales.

## Gmail Trigger
Polls unread INBOX emails and passes raw message data into the workflow.

## Slack Notifications
Sends success confirmations and manual-review alerts to the selected Slack channel.

## Format & Send Email
Formats AI output for Gmail and sends the reply; also stores summary and GEO used.

## GEO Identifier
AI infers customer GEO from email content, address hints, and language cues.

## Manual Review
Routes non-query or uncertain items to Slack for human review and triage.

## Email Classification
Determines if the message is a customer query and assigns a category and reason.

## Extract Email Data
Extracts sender, subject, and snippet to prepare inputs for classification.

## GEO-Optimized Support Reply
Generates a ready-to-send reply with tone and content tailored to the detected GEO.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Strict JSON Required
All AI agents MUST return valid JSON exactly matching the parser schema. Extra text will break downstream parsing and sending.

## Error Handling
Captures workflow failures and sends details to Slack for quick debugging.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

generic.label: Creating Error Workflows in n8n

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
